result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian R Calvo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christian R Calvo not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Christian R Calvo.  
Attorney William Ackell and Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense waiting for  offer from the State and request an adjournment.
State waiting for dna results and will forwarded to defense upon receipt.
 Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christian R Calvo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Christian R Calvo.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Scheduling Conference.
Court waived appearance.
Defense in receipt of some discovery and waiting for offer.

Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christian R Calvo appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Christian R Calvo.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective W. Savagian. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christian R Calvo not in court, defendant in custody. Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini with Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request a State V-Lee Hearing, court denied request. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMA (DOB 10/04/1991), HRH (DOB 01/27/1998), BMR (DOB 05/11/1996), JLW (DOB 02/22/1986), or any of their residences.

Defendant Christian R Calvo in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Christian R Calvo in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christian R Calvo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
